column4: I was attempting to install Ubuntu after having already installed windows so I could dual boot.  I think when I installed Ubuntu I accidentally put GRUB on the MBR because it refuses to work.  Is there anyway to correct this?
When I attempt to boot, GRUB dies at step 1.5
I'm running from the live cd right now
how would I get the HD installed version to run if I can't even get GRUB working?
I can't see myself going back to C++ after D
How is your disc partitioned, how big is it and how old is your PC ?
I don't see how that's relevant
If the partition grub installs its stage 1.5/2 on is somewhere the BIOS can't find then things break wonderfully
the box is no older than 3 years, the hd is 200gb, split evenly into 98 for windows and 98 for xfs + swap
Hmm OK, not too unreasonable - you using xfs as your root file system?
yes, I will be once I fix my install
That's a little unusual - its the only unusual thing I can see; make a /boot partition, and make that something more common, ext3 say
Bonus points if you put the /boot nearer the start of the disc
In principal I don't think it should - but I've had bad look with xfs and it is the only unusual thing I can see in your install
